msbt.message: Strength training doesn't just mean doing any ol' exercise.Let me teach you how to do some -style training!
Try lifting your butt out of your chair, but only barely. Keep the weight on your toes, . Getting swole doesn't happen overnight! Remember that!

No matter how you want to develop your bod, you gotta remember that muscles need to rest.So if you spend a bunch of time on your arms, give them a day or two to recover before hitting 'em again.If you make sure to pace yourself, you'll feel better, AND you'll have more fun, !

A rigorous exercise routine can be hard to maintain, right?Walking or some other light exercise can be a good substitute on days when you're busy with other stuff.But be sure you wear socks, 'cause you could get blisters or chafed skin if you don't, . Then again, once you're at my level, your calluses will be so thick you can probably skip the socks.

If you want to get big muscles, go with low reps and heavier weights.If you want to tone your muscles, do more reps with lighter weights.These are the basics of the -style system.Maybe aim for 30 reps per day for heavy or light weights, . That should work for ya!

There are lots of strength-training programs, but the most important thing is consistency, . Visualize the bod you want to have and go after it.Six-pack abs Bulging biceps It all depends on visualization and follow-through.

Good answer! But comfort isn't really all that important to me.What matters is thisâ€”does it show off my muscles to everyone on the island, ?

Huh. You know your sportswear! That's what most folks would say, butWell, for me, breathability is just a secondary concern, .What I want in a shirt is a fabric that wicks my sweat in a way that makes my muscles look even bigger!

Oh! How did you know? Good brain muscle ya got there!The smaller the shirt, the bigger my muscles look. It's simple geometry!My muscles are pretty much my top fashion accessory, so I want 'em looking their best, !
Yeah, a cool design can catch your eye, right?The design draws you in, and then my sculpted pecs take over. It's a perfect tag team, !
Everybody seems to hate muscle soreness, but I actually don't mind it, .
When my muscles are sore, I know my workout is getting results, and that makes me happy, . Plus, it actually feels pretty good!

Muscle soreness is just my muscles' way of talking to me, right?That communication makes me feel connected to my muscles, and that makes me happy, .I want to keep training and have more chats with my muscles!

The other day, said, "My arm muscles are so sore!"So I said, "Which arm muscles?" And goes, "I don't know."But there's a lot of range there You could be talking about biceps, triceps, or even forearm muscles.You gotta know your arms!
By the way, don't you just love a good massage to ease your sore muscles, ?
Definitely. Yeah! It's the best.

You know what I mean!<10_4 /> And in my case, I'm trained in massage, so I can just give myself one. It's like I'm training for the massage, and I'm massaging for the training!
